intro: Mayepea timorensis, commonly known as the Timor mayepea, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Timor. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
